Il gioco è senza dubbio eccezionale. Nonostante sia un gioco del 2004, la grafica e gli effetti speciali (distruzioni, esplosioni ecc...) risultano piacevoli e coinvolgenti. La storia è bella e non lascia l'amaro in bocca in nessun capitolo del gioco. Il livello dell'Anticittadino è un capolavoro assoluto (vedrete quando ci giocherete). I personaggi principali sono molto carismatici, in particolare Alyx che risulta essere un'ottima spalla per tutta l'esperienza di gioco (un vero piacere). La colonna sonora non è all'altezza del gioco e non ho apprezzato il doppiaggio in italiano che risulta veramente pessimo (forse il peggiore della storia). Le uniche voci gradevoli sono quelle di Alyx, di suo padre e del professore. Nonostante questo, il gioco è consigliato al 100 % e l'acquisto è d'obbligo. Spero che esca Half life 3.

I Love Everything About This Game, Except For Ravenholm.

[i]Half-Life 2[/i], così come il precedente capitolo della serie, costituisce una delle più importanti pietre miliari della storia dei videogiochi. Molti sono gli elementi che lo hanno reso leggendario: la trama, degna delle migliori opere di fantascienza, l’ambientazione estremamente suggestiva e diversificata, i personaggi unici e caratteristici, lo sviluppo avvincente della storia e il lodevole comparto grafico e tecnico. Questo, signori miei, è un must assoluto per ogni videogiocatore che si rispetti, senza se e senza ma, da giocare preferibilmente dopo il primo [i]Half-Life[/i]. Unico suo difetto è il doppiaggio italiano: in nome di tutto ciò che è sacro, installate la versione originale! Non è difficile: dopo aver scaricato il gioco, cercatelo sulla Libreria, cliccate con il pulsante destro del mouse su di esso, quindi selezionate [i]Proprietà[/i] e [i]Lingua[/i]. Ripeto: se volete definirvi videogiocatori, [i]Half-Life 2[/i] è un punto di riferimento assolutamente indispensabile.

I purchased this in 2010 and it is obvious why this game is held in such high regard.  While some people may think the graphics are dated compared to today's standards, they are still extremely well done and are well suited for the story.  People must have been blown away when this was released in 2004.  Great story and atmosphere. Definitely worth it if you catch it on a Steam sale.

If, like me, you missed out on this when it was new news... don't delay. I suspect this was never much of a game to satiate hardcore FPS fans, but for the rest of us the blend of action, 3D and physics puzzle solving — and above all, really, really good narrative, voice acting, and general execution — is a potent, addictive mix, and one that continues to age very well, I'd say.

The cleverly fleshed-out story arc, character development, truly inspired sound design, and solid game mechanics are the product and driver of the game's greatest asset — heaps of heart. Gordon Freeman may never utter a single audible word or offer any dialogue choices, but by focusing on where it can *really* deliver the goods,  HL2 creates a far more compelling, immersive experience than many a "sandbox" can but dream of.
"..."   -Gordan Freeman

I don't think I really need to introduce this one, but... Half-Life 2. For all the hype, I was expecting it to be worse than told. This worked in my favor, as it was therefore better than expected! It's really rather good. I can see now why Valve was heralded as gods, even before Portal 2 came out! Certainly blows the original Half-Life completely out of the water. Now, complaints: it's hyperlinear. I don't think Pokémon Snap was this goddamn linear. And Gordon Freeman is an awful character, no shut up. He is. Claude from GTA3 has more personality, yes he does. OKAY. BUT. NONE OF THIS MATTERS. YOU WON'T NOTICE. You will be far too busy sicking giant bugs on people in high up places and physicsing people to deaths most horrible and, if you're anything like me, completely breaking the game and riding through fun glitches at every single possible turn! Wheeeeeeeee!
e un gioco FA-VO-LO-SO..e lo consiglio propio tutti!!!!!

Great experience and gameplay

Um es kurz zu sagen: Half Life 2 ist einfach unglaublich! Es nimmt die besten Sachen vom originalen Half Life und tut neue Gameplay Elemente hinzufügen, die so das Spiel noch besser machen als den Vorgänger. 
Beispielsweise die beiden Fahrsequenzen mit dem Boot und dem Buggy machen dank der Source Engine sehr Spaß und sind einfach toll. Das beste am Spiel ist aber ganz klar die Gravity Gun. Einfach eine einzigartige Waffe, die auch dank der  Source Enigne  viel Spaß machen. Und das Level gegen Ende des Spiels mit der großen Schlacht gegen die Stryder ist einfach genial und das ganz ohne Cutscense. Die Story des ehemaligen Black Mesa Forscher Gordan Freeman wird dazu spannend weitergeführt und mit tollen neuen Charakteren wie Alxy Vance oder Barney, der jetzt mehr als einen Satz sagt, erweitert. Der G-Man spielt auch wieder seine mysteriöse Rolle. Zwar werden noch mehr Fragen gestellt als beantwortet, aber hoffentlich werden die Fragen in den kommenden 
Half Lifes beantwortet!

Uno de los grandes juegos de la historia. En su día, sorprendió su motor gráfico y físicas, hoy en día ya muy superados, su narrativa sigue conservando su gran nivel.

Forma parte de la historia del videojuego.
If you're on steam and don't have this, go back to Origin.

Like FPS? This is one. Exciting, suspensful story, good game mechanics, interesting NPCs. Basically the current standard for good FPS. Still.

I really feel like I should say more about this game, but there's not much more to say. This is still the game by which all others in the genre are measured, in every way. Graphics, controls, story, voice-acting, characters, weapons, challenge, immersion, design and sound. Everything about this game is very, very good. This is the game that made Steam work. Half-Life 2 was the first game that required activation on Steam, and that made a lot of people mad at first. But once people caught on to the fact that this was a good thing, they stopped caring.

But I digress (no, really. I just go on and on if somebody doesn't hit me). There are certainly games in the genre with better graphics, and ones with better weapons. But this game is VERY GOOD in every category, making it an excellent barometer. Oh. By the way. This game is 8 years old. In eight years, no FPS has overtaken HL2.

[UPDATE]
It's now November of 2013, making Half-Life 2 9 years old. I STILL believe it's the gold standard of FPS games. If anyone disagrees, I would love to hear about it. If someone can convince me that I'm wrong, there would definitely be prizes (no joke. I've got some duplicates of things that I got in Humble Bundles, etc).

(I've played this game multiple times on another account. Just a disclaimer.)

Half-Life 2 is the reason why I play video games. It perfectly captures everything that makes a video game great, and does everything so well it is almost the definition of whatever it is doing. The perfect gunplay, pacing, level design, controls, atmosphere, AI, and the timeless graphics which still more than hold up to today's games are all hallmarks of Valve's masterpiece. The original Half-Life may have changed the gaming landscape forever, but its successor only proves that Valve is not content with resting on their success. 

Half-Life 2 doesn't put the gameplay in the back seat for story, nor the other way around. In fact, Half-Life 2 is the rare occurence where story and gameplay don't take turns, nor do they ever downplay each other when it is seen convienient. It's every aspect of video games that you have ever liked in one game, and it is a beautiful thing to witness.

Few games are better made than Half-Life 2. If you are anywhere near curious to check out what all the fuss is about, by all means hop aboard. City 17 awaits you.
A living classic, we all want continuation...

Half-Life 2, probably Valve's most well known game besides Portal or Left 4 Dead. Half-Life 2 is not your typical first-person shooter. It's not the same Call of Duty formula we've seen so many times. This game takes place in a future where humanity is now ruled by the Combine, a super powerful alien force released onto earth after the disaster a Black Mesa from the first game. You play as Gordon Freeman as you try to defeat the Combine and their oppresive force. All I can say is buy this game. It was a brilliant game back in 2004 and it's a brilliant game now.

Simply the best and longest story an FPS has to offer, much more originality than other titles like Call of Duty. If you like story in your FPS I strongly recommend this game.

Side notes: If you want to buy this remember that it is usually $9.99 on Steam or you can get the Orange Box that comes with Portal, Half-Life 2 with 3 expansions packs, and a Team Fortress 2 Proof of Purchase for $19.99.

I feel like Halo drew a lot of it's antagonist-wise story elements from Half-Life.

There's no easy way to recomend Half-Life 2 enough because it is a yard stick, both games and sequels are compared to it and when you  have something as amazing you have to describe how good it is by itself.

Like Half-Life it is truly massive,the levels are hugely expansive and built in a way that means you never really see the same tjing twice. The story is brilliant,the puzzles are as good as ever and and it never misses a chance to make the point that this is how FPS's should be done in the modern era.

It's downfall, of which i can only think of one, is a side effect of the huge levels; loading screens, which for a good system are nothing but on an older system they may get slightly tiresome. That is older by 2004 standards though!

Half-Life 2 is an amazing game and one of the best games I have ever played in my entire lifetime. It was revolutionary for it's time, and it still is. The gameplay, the graphics, the story, the AI, the atmosphere, the level design, the enemies, everything that is great in a game is in this game!

Half-Life 2 follows a man named Gordon Freeman who used to work in Black Mesa (The events of Half-Life 1) where a zombie outbreak occured after they opened a portal to another dimension. Half-Life 2 takes place roughly 20 years after the events of the first Half-Life game. You are Gordon Freeman who is awoken from cyrogenic sleep. Gordon was put into cyrogenic sleep because a man named G-Man followed him throughout Half-Life 1 (And still does in Half-Life 2) to witness how amazing Freeman was at combat. He said that when the world is in a major crysis, he will wake up Gordon again. Gordon wakes up in a train going into City 17 where an alien group called the Combine have taken over Earth in just

If you've played any single-player videogame in the past decade, then you've played Half-Life 2. The impact this game has had on the fundamentals of the FPS genre cannot be overstated, and it's a good opportunity to go back and see where it all started.
